Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and multi-coloured in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394738) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394738)
